summary:
Heroes get remembered,
But legends never die.
Follow your heart, kid
And you'll never go wrong.
—The Sandlot

summary: So with possibly only (sure to be amazing) prequels to satisfy fans until Avengers 4 I've been doing some thinking about Iron...
body:
The Iron Man Mantle

So with possibly only (sure to be amazing) prequels to satisfy fans until Avengers 4 I’ve been doing some thinking about Iron Man and what Downey’s longtime involvement with the franchise means for the MCU mantle

In an effort to start conversation, in my opinion there are a few different options if we’re really looking at the end of the original Iron Man as we know him coming to an end with Avengers 4

1. Tony Stark lives through “Infinity War P. 2” and gets his happy ending with Pepper, and continues on in the background of the MCU without really retiring the mantle of Iron Man.

I don’t really see this happening, or at least not both aspects of the scenario. Without going into the several death flags surrounding Tony in Infinity War, I don’t see how Stark is going to continue the title. This coming finale to what has been one tremendous arc would be the perfect time to change up the character that started it all, permanently. I’m sure the Russo Brothers and the writers know that people are expecting this finale to come with lasting consequences. This movie desperately needs weight, even if we all want the happy ending. Not to mention the fact that Downey deserves his break. Even if the character lives I don’t see more than one other major film for the character coming out. Avengers 4 would be an expected and acceptable goodbye for Iron Man, dead or alive.

2. Iron Man lives and retires the mantle, perhaps officially handing it down to another hero.

This is one I see as more plausible. Tony really got into almost a “God Mode” with this newest movie, being such a seasoned superhero with his incredible tech. There is no “Homecoming”, with a struggle to sort out new abilities. This would plausibly lead to an overpowered Iron Man going into future movies, if he maintains all of his research/resources. A refreshing of the mantle would feasibly set the skill set back some way, and in general change up the character.

3. Tony Stark does not live through “Infinity War P. 2”, and someone else takes up the mantle after his passing.

This is by far the most heartbreaking of the options I have considered, but I also see it happening. Truthfully not as much as the second, because that would most likely anger audiences the least, but if I’m right about flags then in Tony’s absence I don’t see how no one would step up to take care of all his tech. Perhaps not at first, in a mourning phase. But eventually it would be logical to… use it remotely to aid in the excursions of other superheroes? Or maybe later down the road it would be utilized by an older and more independent MCU Spiderman. (He is quite the genius in his own right in many comic iterations.)

Or, in my opinion the most exciting option of all, a solo superhero taking responsibility for his inventions.

Maybe War Machine would lead a legion of suits?

Maybe Shuri could become an MCU take on Riri Williams? With how awkward her recent reintroduction to the comics has been, it would be appreciated. Also, with the new Black Panther most likely continuing his story, she deserves her own badass superhero mantle.

Or maybe the kid from Iron Man 3 makes a return? At this point all the doors are open.

At the end of the day I’m just super excited to see where this universe (and all the other realities) go in the upcoming Marvel movies. Sorry for triggering any of you, feel free to come yell at me in my inbox/messages.

title: Koschei
body:
“It was beautiful. Like nothing I’ve ever seen before. It was like an everlasting sunset on a plane of nothingness.” - Ava Collins

Pulvis et umbra sumus

I sit silently by myself on the quinjet. I’m trying to think about all the different ways this is going to go down. I like to act tough, but I’m scared shitless. I am sweating and pale and I’m…

Read more…

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Bad At Love
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2wYJgQ8

by mareywrites

Peter Parker has always despised Michelle Jones, since the 5th grade. Michelle is someone he can’t figure out and someone who feels the need to always annoy him. Luckily, Ned Leeds knows exactly how to bring his two best friends together.

Words: 492, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of Spider-Man Homecoming Stories

At the Disco and Imagine Dragons!

summary: My Favorite Marvel Ships (Hetero & Same Sex) Appreciation
body:
My Favorite Marvel Ships (Hetero & Same Sex) Appreciation

Cause we all have our faves and are allowed to ship in whatever we want!:

Tony Stark & Pepper Potts (Pepperony):

First major Marvel ship and had healthy, steady slow burn growth! Although their break up around Civil War left Tony in a really low place with pretty much everyone in his life, apart from probably Rhodey, Happy, and Team Iron Man; they’re better than ever and engaged! Hopefully they will be able to get married and live happily ever after.

Steve Rogers and Bucky Barnes (Stucky):

This one’s rough for me after Infinity War. They were childhood friends and probably realized they loved each other as more than just that. Steve, of course never knew he was alive and had been brainwashed by Hydra after World War II and had been used as a highly trained assassin we know as the Winter Soldier. He still managed to find Bucky and get him to remember their relationship enough after Civil War to where Buck was put back in cryogenic suspension in Wakanda and fighting along side each other until the snap.

Steve Rogers and Natasha Romanoff (Romanogers):

I just love these two so much! They have great chemistry and have such a range to their relationship. From some serious sexual tension in the hospital scene after Nick Fury was brought in in Captain America: The Winter Soldier, to Nat still being loyal to Steve even after choosing Team Iron Man in Civil War, to their time on the run in Infinity War. Even if they just had a kiss to keep cover in TWS, it was still super hot!

Peter Quill/Star Lord and Gamora (Starmora):

These two are amazing with how far their relationship has come! From Gamora hating Peter and his music, attitude, and probably anything about him to wanting him to kill her so Thanos dont have the chance. Peter was willing to make the ultimate sacrifice because he loved Gamora so much. And referring to himself as a long term Titan killing booty call instead of her boyfriend was such a Star Lord thing to do.

Stephen Strange and Christine Palmer:

I love how the writers of Doctor Strange did something different and made the dynamic between these two as exes, who remained corgial co-workers after they broke up. Christine was there for Stephen after his car accident and through his surgeries and didn’t want to see him continue to suffer in trying to make his hands fully functioning again. Stephen Strange had such a huge ego, but it took all of his instruction under The Ancient One and having Christine saving him from dying to fully show that everything in his life wasn’t about him. And they parted each other on such sweet and amicable terms. I hope we can see them again.

Wanda Maximoff and Vision:

These two are super cute and deeply care for each other, even if their relationship is super unconventional because one is an android being. Vision knows he is valued by both the Avengers and enemies for having an Infinity Stone in his head and Wanda is the best protector of him. They know their time may be short because of that and accept their love for each other. Even if they both took different sides in Civil War, they made up and were never without each other until the end of Infinity War when all hell broke loose.

Even if they just had a kiss to keep cover in TWS, it was still super hot!

Peter Quill/Star Lord and Gamora (Starmora):

These two are amazing with how far their relationship has come! From Gamora hating Peter and his music, attitude, and probably anything about him to wanting him to kill her so Thanos dont have the chance. Peter was willing to make the ultimate sacrifice because he loved Gamora so much. And referring to himself as a long term Titan killing booty call instead of her boyfriend was such a Star Lord thing to do.

Stephen Strange and Christine Palmer:

I love how the writers of Doctor Strange did something different and made the dynamic between these two as exes, who remained corgial co-workers after they broke up. Christine was there for Stephen after his car accident and through his surgeries and didn’t want to see him continue to suffer in trying to make his hands fully functioning again. Stephen Strange had such a huge ego, but it took all of his instruction under The Ancient One and having Christine saving him from dying to fully show that everything in his life wasn’t about him. And they parted each other on such sweet and amicable terms. I hope we can see them again.

Wanda Maximoff and Vision:

These two are super cute and deeply care for each other, even if their relationship is super unconventional because one is an android being. Vision knows he is valued by both the Avengers and enemies for having an Infinity Stone in his head and Wanda is the best protector of him. They know their time may be short because of that and accept their love for each other. Even if they both took different sides in Civil War, they made up and were never without each other until the end of Infinity War when all hell broke loose.

trail.content_raw:
My Favorite Marvel Ships (Hetero & Same Sex) Appreciation

Cause we all have our faves and are allowed to ship in whatever we want!:

Tony Stark & Pepper Potts (Pepperony):

First major Marvel ship and had healthy, steady slow burn growth! Although their break up around Civil War left Tony in a really low place with pretty much everyone in his life, apart from probably Rhodey, Happy, and Team Iron Man; they’re better than ever and engaged! Hopefully they will be able to get married and live happily ever after.

Steve Rogers and Bucky Barnes (Stucky):

This one’s rough for me after Infinity War. They were childhood friends and probably realized they loved each other as more than just that. Steve, of course never knew he was alive and had been brainwashed by Hydra after World War II and had been used as a highly trained assassin we know as the Winter Soldier. He still managed to find Bucky and get him to remember their relationship enough after Civil War to where Buck was put back in cryogenic suspension in Wakanda and fighting along side each other until the snap.

Steve Rogers and Natasha Romanoff (Romanogers):

I just love these two so much! They have great chemistry and have such a range to their relationship. From some serious sexual tension in the hospital scene after Nick Fury was brought in in Captain America: The Winter Soldier, to Nat still being loyal to Steve even after choosing Team Iron Man in Civil War, to their time on the run in Infinity War. Even if they just had a kiss to keep cover in TWS, it was still super hot!

Peter Quill/Star Lord and Gamora (Starmora):

These two are amazing with how far their relationship has come! From Gamora hating Peter and his music, attitude, and probably anything about him to wanting him to kill her so Thanos dont have the chance. Peter was willing to make the ultimate sacrifice because he loved Gamora so much. And referring to himself as a long term Titan killing booty call instead of her boyfriend was such a Star Lord thing to do.

Stephen Strange and Christine Palmer:

I love how the writers of Doctor Strange did something different and made the dynamic between these two as exes, who remained corgial co-workers after they broke up. Christine was there for Stephen after his car accident and through his surgeries and didn’t want to see him continue to suffer in trying to make his hands fully functioning again. Stephen Strange had such a huge ego, but it took all of his instruction under The Ancient One and having Christine saving him from dying to fully show that everything in his life wasn’t about him. And they parted each other on such sweet and amicable terms. I hope we can see them again.

Wanda Maximoff and Vision:

These two are super cute and deeply care for each other, even if their relationship is super unconventional because one is an android being. Vision knows he is valued by both the Avengers and enemies for having an Infinity Stone in his head and Wanda is the best protector of him. They know their time may be short because of that and accept their love for each other. Even if they both took different sides in Civil War, they made up and were never without each other until the end of Infinity War when all hell broke loose.
trail.content:

Cause we all have our faves and are allowed to ship in whatever we want!:

Tony Stark & Pepper Potts (Pepperony):

First major Marvel ship and had healthy, steady slow burn growth! Although their break up around Civil War left Tony in a really low place with pretty much everyone in his life, apart from probably Rhodey, Happy, and Team Iron Man; they’re better than ever and engaged! Hopefully they will be able to get married and live happily ever after.

blog.name: thevanillahorizon
blog.title: Socially Awkward
blog.description:
I'm twenty, sort of artistic, I have an obsession with fictional reformed bad guys and enjoy writing fanfiction.

((Ravenclaw pride))

summary: I sort of accidentally made this headcanon a minute ago that while Tony was telling Bruce the story (of Iron man 3) the events...
body: I sort of accidentally made this headcanon a minute ago that while Tony was telling Bruce the story (of Iron man 3) the events of Captain America the winter soldier were taking place and that Tony got cut off afterwards by Jarvis announcing that three helicarriers were crashing down, so he suited up and took off to make sure no civilians were in trouble and after Bucky took Steve ashore, that Tony was actually the one who found him and took him to the hospital (Because the ambulance would take too long) and he was actually the second person Steve seen after he woke up
